comments: use the book and watch the dvds to learn. takes a while to learn sign language but shes patient. study a lot and pay attention. you cant really dose off in class. 2 tests which consist of grammar and signing. you need to remember a story. you have to sign in front of class.grading is somewhat fair. no curved grade. dont take it if you dont need to.

She is an amazing but tough teacher. Study hard for tests, they are quite comprehensive. She really helped the class out by offering lots of extra credit which is highly recommended you do. She can be really fun but stay focused in class and review your signs when not in class so you\'re prepared and you\'ll do fine.

I LOVEDDDD THIS PROF. She is deaf but still some how i learned so much, i learned more in one semester of ASL than i did in 3 years of spanish i refuse to take 10B with anyone else but prof smith. its not an easy A though you really have to practice after 10A my study grp and i can already have little conversations TAKE IT! YOU WONT REGRET IT!

This is an intro course and taught completely in sign language. She doesn\'t follow the order of the book and the exercises and hand outs on not often clear. She canceled our class due to her personal issues . She graded unfairly embarrassed certain students in class. Take another route if you can.

She\'s a great Teach! I love her, she is soo funny. You\'ll enjoy her class, it never feels like work. The only thing she is up tight about is cheating during test taking. I\'ve take her for 10a and 10b, and going on 10c. Shes awesome!

I have taken both ASL 1 and 3 with Michele and she is great! I learned a lot, she\'s an amazing person. She has a good sense of humor, which helps the class go along. ASL is not an easy subject to learn, but she helps you a lot. I highly recommend you take this class. You will not regret this at all.
